Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can draw a plant with bright green leaves to show it has enough water and light. (basic understanding of healthy plant features)
The student can draw a plant with wilted or brown leaves to show it does not have enough water. (understands basic signs of an unhealthy plant)
The student can partially use arrows to indicate the sun shining on the plant, showing it needs light. (might not consistently use arrows correctly)
CANNOT: The student may struggle to correctly depict a comparison side-by-side of a healthy plant and an unhealthy plant. (does not fully grasp the difference)
The student may inconsistently include raindrops or a watering can in their drawing to indicate the plant's need for water. (might omit these elements or use them randomly)
The student may not use different colors effectively to represent healthy and unhealthy plants. (might use colors inconsistently or incorrectly)
The student may not consistently show the relationship between sunlight, water, and plant health. (may sometimes mix up causes and effects)
